Package com.company

Class Time

java.lang.Object
com.company.Time
public class Time extends Object
Time keeps three integer values as hours, minutes, and seconds. These values are not designed to work as AM and/or PM so range for hours is 0-23.

  • Constructor Details

    • Time

      protected Time(int hours, int minutes, int seconds) throws InvalidAttributeValueException
      Creates a time object with given values.
      Parameters:
      hours - Hours in range of 0-23, included.
      minutes - Minutes in range of 0-59, included.
      seconds - Seconds in range of 0-59, included.
      Throws:
      InvalidAttributeValueException - When out of range value is given.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      String of this time in 'HOURS:MINUTES' format if seconds attribute is 0, 'HOURS:MINUTES:SECONDS' if not

    • setHours

      public void setHours(int hours) throws InvalidAttributeValueException
      Sets hours of this time to given value.
      Parameters:
      hours - New hours for this time.
      Throws:
      InvalidAttributeValueException - When given value is not in the range 0-23 included.

    • setMinutes

      public void setMinutes(int minutes) throws InvalidAttributeValueException
      Sets minutes of this time to given value.
      Parameters:
      minutes - New minutes for this time.
      Throws:
      InvalidAttributeValueException - When given value is not in the range 0-59 included.

    • setSeconds

      public void setSeconds(int seconds) throws InvalidAttributeValueException
      Sets seconds of this time to given value.
      Parameters:
      seconds - New seconds for this time.
      Throws:
      InvalidAttributeValueException - When given value is not in the range 0-59 included.
